// slice variant of https://shadertoy.com/view/DdcXRj

#define rot3(P,A,a)  ( mix( A*dot(P,A), P, cos(a) ) + sin(a)*cross(P,A) ) // 3D rot around an arbitrary axis

#define d(q)                                                                   \
        min( length(q) - 1.7,                             /* sphere  */        \
        abs(fract(atan((q).z,(q).x)/3.14)*3.14-.1)<.1 ? ( length(q) * length( fract(vec2( atan((q).z,(q).x)+.05, atan((q).y,length((q).xz))) /.314) - .5) \
                       - .2 ) : 1e3 )                     // radial bands. Note that *.628 was omitted but should be there
                       
void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9.;
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R),          // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,60), q;                             // marching point along ray 

    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01 && p.z>-4.; O-=.001 )        // march scene  
        q = rot3( p, vec3(sin(iTime),0,cos(iTime)), 3.14 *smoothstep(.05, .6, 1./length(p)) ), // the magic is there
        t = d(q),
        p += .03*t*D;                                      // step forward = dist to obj      

                                                           // color scheme
   D = vec3(-1,1,0)*1e-3,                                  //   efficient FD normals https://iquilezles.org/articles/normalsSDF/
   O.rgb = .5 - .5*normalize(  D.xxy* d( q + D.xxy ) + D.xyx* d( q + D.xyx ) + D.yxx* d( q + D.yxx ) + D.yyy * d( q + D.yyy ) );
}
